fields.name: Raleigh
fields.description: We live in Raleigh! There was no rush to finally "get" this one but a few days after we were engaged, we felt the time was right. You could consider this a bonus engagement shoot.
fields.flag_caption: Flag of the City of Raleigh

fields.name: Augusta
fields.description: Our final capital on our honeymoon road trip. We drove through, saw the capital, and left. The large lawn in front was certainly enjoyable.
fields.flag_caption: Flag of the City of Augusta

fields.name: Cockburn Town, Turks and Caicos
fields.description: Visiting Cockburn Town was not on purpose but when we arrived here on a five-day cruise, we realized it was the capital of Turks and Caicos. We asked a cab driver to take us to their biggest house of government and we ended up at the House of Assembly.
fields.flag_caption: Flag of the territory of Turks and Caicos

fields.name: Charleston
fields.description: This could be considered the first capital on this journey. We had the idea in the car and then decided to make a stop in Charleston on the way up to visit family in Lancaster, Ohio. It's all built from here.
fields.flag_caption: Flag of the City of Charleston

fields.name: Columbus
fields.description: On the same trip that we had the idea for this whole capitals thing, we decided to get Columbus while we were motivated. At the end of this trip, we went into town, took the photos we needed and then headed back to Raleigh.
fields.flag_caption: Flag of the City of Columbus

fields.name: Atlanta
fields.description: This was the first time after having come up with the capitals journey idea that we were in Atlanta to visit Jennifer's parents. We headed out for the day and explored downtown Atlanta, including the state capitol building.
fields.flag_caption: Flag of the City of Atlanta

fields.name: Columbia
fields.description: We stopped in Columbia on the way down to Miami. The detour added about an hour and half to the trip but it was worth getting Columbia knocked out. Their state capitol building has a few stars on it signifying bullet holes from the Civil War.
fields.flag_caption: Flag of the City of Columbia

fields.name: Boston
fields.description: Boston was great. So was the Boston Commons with this capitol building overlooking it. This was the first stop on the honeymoon road trip, where we stayed a few nights at a W Hotel and most of the stay in Boston was rained out. It was chilly for a June day but I guess that's typical in New England.
fields.flag_caption: Flag of the City of Boston

fields.name: Concord
fields.description: On our road trip, we stopped in Concord for lunch at a local deli on the main drag. The capitol building was only a short walk away. We didn't stay long cause we had to keep it moving.
fields.flag_caption: Flag of the City of Concord

fields.name: Montpelier
fields.description: Montpelier didn't have much going on but Vermont wasn't that big either. The town was very picturesque and worth another visit if in the area. It's the smallest capital in the nation.
fields.flag_caption: Flag of the City of Montpelier

fields.name: Frankfort
fields.description: After spending a night and a day in Louisville for Michael and Diana's wedding, we went on a road trip through Illinois but not before stopping in Frankfurt. This tiny town was surrounded a monolithic capitol building.
fields.flag_caption: Flag of the City of Frankfort

fields.name: Springfield
fields.description: We stopped in Springfield for a night during an Illinois road trip. Horseshoes were definitely a part of this stop.
fields.flag_caption: Flag of the City of Springfield

fields.name: Albany
fields.description: For Leo's birthday, we planned to see New York City and Niagara Falls. We took the train out of New York and into Albany where we saw the huge State House. Jennifer was about 21-weeks pregnant at this point.
fields.flag_caption: Flag of the City of Albany

fields.name: St. Paul
fields.description: We came to Minnesota for a funeral, more of a wake really, for Jennifer's grandfather. While here, we made a point to see the capitol building in St. Paul which was currently under renovation.
fields.flag_caption: Flag of the City of St. Paul

fields.name: Richmond
fields.description: Our first time in Richmond, we decided to go on a Labor Day weekend. It was an easy 24 hours where we arrived for lunch, ate dinner in the hotel, because of Rory's early bedtime, and then breakfast the next day before heading home. Rory was just really starting to walk and she was able to climb all those stairs to the front door of Virginia's State House.
fields.flag_caption: Flag of the City of Richmond

fields.name: Washington DC, U.S.A.
fields.description: Technically not part of the capitals journey since we had the idea AFTER visiting DC, we're still throwing this one in here as this was our first visit to DC together.
fields.flag_caption: Flag of the District of Columbia

fields.name: Nairobi, Kenya
fields.description: Leo was sent to Nairobi to help install some server hardware at a new research center on a catholic university. Naturally, we found a way for Jennifer to tag along.
fields.flag_caption: Flag of the City of Nairobi

fields.name: Annapolis
fields.description: We wanted to get in another capital this year, 2017, so decided to visit Annapolis as it was close enough to drive and easy to visit for a weekend. (and with a toddler) The historic district was pretty fun to walk around, including the Maryland State house, and we got a taste of the Chesapeake Bay with an afternoon harbor tour.
fields.flag_caption: Flag of the City of Annapolis. In Latin, it says, "I have lived free and will die so."

fields.name: Brussels, Belgium
fields.description: Brussels was a stop during a trip from Paris and through Belgium. In addition, to the capital city, we also saw Bruges.
fields.flag_caption: Flag of the City of Brussels

fields.name: Paris, France
fields.description: Non-stop from RDU to Paris, we started and ended our trip in Paris. We spent a few days here in addition to stops in nearby Belgium.
fields.flag_caption: Flag of the City of Paris

fields.name: Indianapolis
fields.description: During the yearly 4th of July visit to Lancaster, OH, we drove out to Indy for the afternoon and overnight. We learned that it's probably not a great time to tour cities during the 4th cause a lot of things are closed plus it was hot that week. Still, we got the capitol building shots and saw the Soldiers' and Sailors' Monument.
fields.flag_caption: Flag of Indianapolis, Indiana

fields.name: Nashville
fields.description: Ready for Spring and eager to spend some time out of Raleigh, we three went to Nashville for a weekend to see this capital. It was an easy flight straight there and Rory enjoyed the hotel so much she didn't want to leave it at times. We managed to see the Country Music Hall of Fame Museum, the Johnny Cash Museum, and we even walked a little of Broadway. We also took Rory to a show at the Nashville Children's Theater which was fine as the weather turned much cooler than we wanted it to be.
fields.flag_caption: City of Nashville Flag

fields.name: Buenos Aires, Argentina
fields.description: We flew down to Buenos Aires and stayed in Palermo for a few days. We explored this great Argentine capital city, eating some great food and experiencing all the entertaining street life, culture, and art.
fields.flag_caption: Flag for the city of Buenos Aires

fields.name: Lansing
fields.description: While visiting family in Lancaster Ohio, we took a weekend roadtrip to Michigan to check out Lansing. We saw the capitol building, of course, and got to see the world's largest lug nut.
fields.flag_caption: City of Lansing Flag

fields.name: Sacramento
fields.description: We came out to California to visit Gordi and Nancy for July 4th. After a few days in Mountain View and a day trip to San Francisco, we drove out to Muir Woods, Point Reyes, and Petaluma. Then, we stopped in Sacramento for the day where we visited the Capitol, walked around Old Sacramento, and loosened up at a city park.
fields.flag_caption: City of Sacramento Flag
